reviews.review_msg: Wereha is entertaining, cynical, & thought-provoking. He spends more time challenging the material we are taught instead of repeating it to us verbatim. While his course is challenging, he presents a philosophical spin on his lessons, and if you have the capacity to stretch yourself intellectually & work hard, you will enjoy his class & succeed.

If you don't have a sense of humour, I feel sorry for you.  But more importantly, don't take his class.  One of the best psych profs at SFU, totally made every class worth attending.  Funny as hell and VERY personable.    If I could give him a hot chili, I totally would.  :D

Two tests worth 40% and a paper worth 20%, so gg if you mess something up because there's almost no recovering. The written portions of tests are all based on lecs & his opinions, so don't even try to pull stuff from the text for info. Maybe this was on me, but the paper was super unclear & I ended up doing the whole thing wrong. Engaging guy tho.

Taking this class with Tyler was great! Lectures were interesting and it's nice that Tyler adds his own perspective on the generic stance the textbooks take. Gives you study questions that show up on the exam beforehand. Tyler's a funny guy - memes on every slide and interesting media supplements. HIGHLY recommend!
Great TA for this class.

Awesome prof. Very caring and always ensures his students understand what is going on in his class. Many profs forget what it's like to learn the basics, and don't know how to explain them so they're easy understand, but Tyler makes the material relatable and accessible.

WARNING DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM. Everyone I talked to him strongly STRONGLY did not like him, and I did not either. He is a pompous ass. Honestly he's the type of guy to make his own reviews on here... I'm pretty sure all of the "excellent reviews" are from him...  He sucks. Too bad there isn't a "not respected by students" button

Tyler was a great instructor. He keeps lectures fun (even at 830 in the morning), records his lectures, and is always willing to discuss anything. Plays music in class, uses memes and photos in lecture slides, bases tests off of textbook but projects off of your own thoughts and beliefs. Pushes students to think critically about info in class

Best Professor I've had so far. Extremely passionate and interested in what he teaches and makes the material interesting to students as well. Does not just regurgitate material but rather looks for a more critical understanding of the course material. Absolutely hilarious which makes lectures more interesting & actually cares about his students.

I liked how he sometimes yelled during the class because 8:30 lecture in the morning can be very dreadful if the professor is monotoned. Tyler however has amazing ability to keep students alert during the class and does not just teach stuff from textbook. Make sure you study his study questions he assigns at the end of the class. Fair exams.

Tyler is an interesting guy. He is pretty funny, but I kind of get confused by his humor tbh. I'm not sure what to take in as actual knowledge and what is just anecdotal. He is on his way to being a great professor!
He is amazing and the best prof i have met at SFU
Really awesome class! Tyler is super funny and is available to help you out with any questions.

Tyler Wereha is hands down the best professor I've ever had. He is well spoken, relatable, and kind. If you get the chance to take a class with Tyler make sure you don't squander it. His lectures are so much fun you will be counting the days until your next class. I took PSYC1100 with him and I regularly reference what he taught me in daily life.

Makes you get really worked up about the misinterpretation of Piaget. Seriously, I'm so mad. He's an AMAZING prof though, forces you to think critically about your material instead of robotically accepting it. Midterms and Finals are all short answer, teaches like he just came off a reddit rant. Entertaining. Very worth it. No textbook.

Dr. Wereha takes his role as an educator seriously. He actually wants his students to learn evolutionary themes and to think critically about these issues. It is rare to find a professor that genuinely cares about his students, especially in larger research universities. Dr. Wereha was definitely one of the better professors I've had at SFU.

I would highly recommend taking one of Tyler's classes! His passion and enthusiasm really reflect in his lectures, making them interesting and a pleasure to attend. By far one of the best profs I have had during my undergraduate studies!

Both 354 and 385 with Tyler were great! He doesn't teach so you will regurgitate the textbook or slideshows, he's teaches you skills to thoroughly evaluate the knowledge and information around you, which is a nice change! His grading criteria is CLEAR, so the effort you put in, is the grade you will receive.  Trust me, take a class with him!

Fun class to take. His notes are easy to read and he encourages critical thinking while criticizing others' work. Assignments require lots of thinking and well-related to the course content, and he provides clear explanation of the requirements. Exams are fair, mostly based on lecture material.  encourages critical thinking,

An amazing prof! He should teach all the psych classes at SFU as far as I'm concerned. If you're in doubt about taking a class with him, don't be. You'll learn to think and have fun doing it. Lectures are a such pleasure to attend!
He is a fantastic and insightful Prof. who will go to the wall to help you understand the topic as long as you go in to see him.
One of the best professors I have had in my past four years at SFU. He is passionate about what he is teaching and gets students engaged with the class materials.

Most approachable prof I have ever had. He is quick to reply to e-mails, is consistent with office hours, and if you don't understand something he is committed to helping you figure it out. Some professors just like hearing the sound of their own voice, but Tyler wants you to learn and makes learning fun.

LOVED THIS CLASS! One of the best professors I've ever had at SFU. He is incredibly passionate in his lectures and makes the material really interesting. He teaches you how to critically think and apply what you learned from his class (which lacks in a lot of classes). Definitely not an easy A, but if you do your study questions, you'll do well!
I think if you take 354 you should get 7 credits. 3 for the course and then the 4 for 300W because this class does a much better job of teaching students how to critically think.

Cannot rate this man high enough. This class is what the university experience should be about: he teaches you how to think and critically evaluate NOT regurgitate facts.  If you have issues with this then do yourself a favour and drop out of university or at least reconsider a career involving research. This school better give him a permanent job.

Tyler's teaching style is amazing! He's very passionate and this comes across in Lectures! At the start of the semester I found him a bit intimidating (due to the yelling a bit), I was hesitant to ask questions but when worked up the courage and went to talk to him in person he was incredibly nice and helpful!

Possibly the best professor I've had since my years at SFU. His lectures actually TEACH something and at the same time interesting and hilarious. Tyler's always so into his lectures and gets excited and would yell suddenly. The assignments require a lot of critical thinking, but them and exams are marked fairly. Thoroughly enjoyed this class.

Be warned: this class is more about what he hates about developmental psychologists rather than actual children's development. But Tyler is great, intelligent, hilarious and his lectures are really interesting. The assignments and exams are fair and his class provides a refreshing perspective on psychology. One thing: he yells when he's excited

One of the best profs I've had! He's just awesome! I would definitely take another course with him.  The exams are essay style, and he gives you a long list of questions to study (which pretty much include all of the material), but they really help you organize the material in your head. The assignments are fair, and I personally enjoyed doing them

Tyler is an amazing professor! very passionate about his course material. Fun lectures that you look forward to going for every week. Tests are fair and assignments make you critically think about the material. Extremely helpful and nice with students. Would love to take another course with him! :)

Dr. Wereha is amazing! He is smart, interesting, funny and easy to pay attention to. He skillfully handles complex material making it accessible and engaging for students. His lectures are dynamic and charged. This is a great class for anyone who hopes to be inspired to think outside the box (or think at all for that matter) BONUS: he's super cute!
Lectures focused way too much on theoreticalmethodological issues to the neglect of actually talking about how children's thinking develops. This is not philosophy for god's sake.
awesome prof! very engaging lectures

Really great professor! Very fun class. Tyler has a gift with teaching and communicating important information to his students. Thought provoking class. learned more about how infants/children are studied than how they actually learn, so it was more theoretical than practical which was what I was expecting. Interesting perspective to learn from.

He is one of those rare charismatic profs. Didn't care for the way he tried to "revolutionize" exams, which were 7 essay questions that he said would be taken directly from the study questions but he ended up changing the questions on the exam. Buut it was easy nonetheless, I mean, it's psych, so nothing is going to be overly difficult.

He really forces you to consider what you're learning, and to think critically about how we study how children develop. Explicitly states he doesn't want you to just regurgitate what he's teaching. Assignments are pretty straight-forward; tests are somewhat difficult, but over all fair. Awesome professor, and very passionate about what he teaches.

This is literally the best prof I have EVER had in post secondary.  However, with that said, he also has some of the hardest tests I've ever had.  I would have failed with any other prof though.  However, Tyler's teaching skills are the best, so I managed to get through it.
Tyler is absolutely amazing!! It is not an easy course but Tyler's lecture is so much fun!! He is so easy to talk with and he knows what he is talking about. Highly recommend!!

Best TA I have ever had. Two courses back to back (psych 300 too) with Tyler as my TA, he was very fair, passionate about what he discussed, interested in us doing better, and an overall epic TA. Recommend him for a prof as well.
Tyler is the most awesome pro I have ever met. Passionate! Crazy! Funny! Critical! Thought provoking! I like him madly!  And his never changed short wearing for the whole summer. Hhahahaha

Tyler is awesome. You can tell he loves what he teaches and is open to his students. However psyc 354 "development of children" should actually be called "how children are researched" it reminds me of a research methods class. I haven't learned anything about how children actually develop! Tyler's great but he should rename the course.

I wish we had had tutorials for this class because Tyler is the kind of TA you want to learn from and have as a friend-tor (friend plus mentor).  He gave excellent, in-depth feedback and is a fair marker.

Tyler is by far the best TA I've ever had! He's down to earth and gives it to you straight- which is extremely refreshing. Not only is he an excellent teacher but a very approachable one. I wouldn't have achieved the same mark if I hadn't attended his tutorials! Definitely taking another class with him!

What a cool dude! I really admire and respect Tyler, as a person and a teacher. He's very helpful, flexible, adaptable and gives excellent feedback - not to mention how approachable and casual he is. I will take another class with him if I can! A+ :)

It's not often that you get a TA who is both knowledgeable and a good teacher, but Tyler is both. His tutorials are engaging, fun, and really helped me to understand the theories presented in lecture and the readings. I definitely recommend taking a course/tutorial with him if you get the chance.

Tyler is an awesome guy. So passionate about teaching students and encouraging them to do their best. Tyler is my favorite TA ever, simply because he cares, and is willing to help you if you struggle (He won't let you fail!)
Awesome guy! Super friendly and easy to talk to. Quite funny too and definitely cares about his students
